channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Target Still Has One Item Way Cheaper Than Walmart---Its Stock
item.description: The retailer’s return to comparable-sales growth and margin recovery are early but encouraging signs of a turnaround.

item.title: Vector Group’s stock up 8% on news to be acquired by Japan’s JT Group in $2.4 billion tobacco deal
item.description: JT, which makes and sells some of the best-known cigarette brands — including Winston and Camel outside the U.S. — will pay $15 a share in cash, equal...

item.title: Luxury Brands Have a Strict Hierarchy. Burberry Found Out the Hard Way.
item.description: The British label’s seven-year push to attract wealthier shoppers has failed and left it with a threadbare share price.

item.title: Subway’s $5 footlong is now the $15 footlong. Customers want the old deal back.
item.description: The five-buck deal, made famous by a memorable jingle, ended in 2014. Subway’s footlongs can now run anywhere from around $8 to $15.

item.title: Schwab Wants to Fix Its Struggling Bank. Investors Are Skeptical.
item.description: The brokerage’s playbook of making easy money on customer deposits was upended when interest rates rose rapidly. Now, it is looking to change how it u...

item.title: Kamala Harris backs Biden’s tax proposals — including a tax on unrealized capital gains
item.description: Kamala Harris’s 2024 presidential campaign supports President Joe Biden’s economic proposals — including one that would tax unrealized capital gains f...

item.title: Texas Instruments Tries to Ease Its Capital Pain
item.description: The chip maker says it might moderate capital spending in 2026 amid activist pressure, but new cash flow targets also hinge on revenue pulling out of ...

item.title: Macy’s stock slides 13% after sales fall short of estimates and retailer lowers guidance
item.description: Macy’s stock fell 8% early Wednesday after the department-store chain missed sales and same-store sales estimates for its fiscal second quarter and lo...

item.title: As Generation X Approaches Retirement, Reality Still Bites
item.description: The ‘forgotten generation,’ born between 1965 and 1980, launched their careers at the start of a massive shift in how Americans work.

item.title: Oil prices fall as revised U.S. jobs data fuel prospects of a demand slowdown
item.description: Gains in crude prices on Wednesday attributed to weekly declines in U.S. crude and product inventories gave way to losses after a downward revision to...
